required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Control After Cardiac Surgery Using Intravenous Acetaminophen
clinical_study.official_title: Intravenous Acetaminophen Analgesia After Cardiac Surgery: A Randomized, Blinded, Controlled Superiority Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing opioid consumption and/or pain intensity scores after cardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing opioid consumption a after cardiac surgery. Total opioid consumption is defined as the total amount amount of opioids administered to patients converted to mg morphine equivalents.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing pain intensity scores after cardiac surgery. Pain scores were measured on the Numeric Rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 (where 0 indicates no pain and 10 indicates the worst pain imaginable).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of any postoperative nausea and vomiting within 24 hours after surgery was collected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 8, 16, and 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative sedation was assessed using the Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale (RASS). It ranges from -5 to +4, where -5 indicates no response to voice or physical stimulation and +4 indicates overtly combative or violent and immediate danger to staff. Lower the value, better the sedation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of surgery until the initial end of ventilation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 1 week.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether IV acetaminophen reduced duration of Mechanical Ventilation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Length of Stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through discharge from ICU
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether IV acetaminophen reduced intensive care unit (ICU) Length of Stay.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery through hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate whether IV acetaminophen hospital length of stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two days after surgery or date of death from any cause, whichever came first
Two days after surgery or date of death from any cause, whichever came first
Measured at 1 day and 2 days after surgery

arm_group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.
Patients will receive up to four doses of IV placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

intervention.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.
Patients will receive up to four doses placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - Males or females 18 years of age or older.
- Non-emergency cardiac surgery via a midline sternotomy at Cleveland Clinic Main Campus.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Redo cardiac surgery.
2. Combined CABG (Coronary Artery Bypass Graft)& valve replacement, multiple valve replacements, Ascending aortic or aortic arch surgery.
3. Weight < 50 Kg or Body mass index > 38 kg/m2.
4. Left ventricle EF ยกร 35% ,Right ventricular moderate or severe dysfunction.
5. Severe (3-4 +) Tricuspid Regurgitation.
6. Recent stroke (within 6 months).
7. Severe lung disease requiring home O2 therapy.
8. Preoperative renal insufficiency (Creatinine > 2.0) or on dialysis.
9. History of liver cirrhosis or active liver disease.
10. Chronic pain conditions controlled by preoperative opioid administration.
11. Known allergy to acetaminophen or fentanyl.

group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. outcome.title: Cumulative Opioid Consumption
outcome.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing opioid consumption a after cardiac surgery. Total opioid consumption is defined as the total amount amount of opioids administered to patients converted to mg morphine equivalents.
outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery

group.title: IV Acetaminophen
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. IV Acetaminophen: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. Placebo: Patients will receive up to four doses placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

measure.title: Cumulative Opioid Consumption
measure.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing opioid consumption a after cardiac surgery. Total opioid consumption is defined as the total amount amount of opioids administered to patients converted to mg morphine equivalents.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Noninferiority was tested using a noninferiority margin of 1.15.
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of geometric means (CI) for IV acetaminophen versus placebo was estimated as the exponentiated treatment effect parameter from a multivariable linear regression model on log opioid consumption adjusting for age and diabetes.

Ratio of geometric means (CI) for IV acetaminophen versus placebo was estimated as the exponentiated treatment effect parameter from a multivariable linear regression model on log opioid consumption adjusting for age and diabetes.

outcome.title: Pain Intensity
outcome.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing pain intensity scores after cardiac surgery. Pain scores were measured on the Numeric Rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 (where 0 indicates no pain and 10 indicates the worst pain imaginable).
outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery
outcome.population: All patients had at least one postoperative pain scores. Some patients did not have a pain score at particular time points if they were unavailable (e.g., at a test), unable to speak (e.g., intubated), asleep, or similar reasons. We report any available pain scores at each time they were collected.

group.title: IV Acetaminophen
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. IV Acetaminophen: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. Placebo: Patients will receive up to four doses placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

measure.title: Pain Intensity
measure.description: Evaluate the noninferiority and efficacy of IV acetaminophen; compared to a placebo, in reducing pain intensity scores after cardiac surgery. Pain scores were measured on the Numeric Rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 (where 0 indicates no pain and 10 indicates the worst pain imaginable).
measure.population: All patients had at least one postoperative pain scores. Some patients did not have a pain score at particular time points if they were unavailable (e.g., at a test), unable to speak (e.g., intubated), asleep, or similar reasons. We report any available pain scores at each time they were collected.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: We assessed whether IV acetaminophen is noninferior to placebo using a noninferiority margin of 1.0.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in overall postoperative pain score means based on a repeated measures linear regression model with an autoregressive correlation structure, adjusting for age, time, and diabetes.
Difference in overall postoperative pain score means based on a repeated measures linear regression model with an autoregressive correlation structure, adjusting for age, time, and diabetes.

outcome.title: Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting
outcome.description: Incidence of any postoperative nausea and vomiting within 24 hours after surgery was collected.
outcome.time_frame: End of surgery through 24 hours after surgery

group.title: IV Acetaminophen
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. measure.title: Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting
measure.description: Incidence of any postoperative nausea and vomiting within 24 hours after surgery was collected.

analysis.estimate_desc: Relative risk of PONV in IV acetaminophen versus placebo patients estimated from a multivariable logistic regression model using the log link and adjusting for age and diabetes.

outcome.title: Postoperative Sedation
outcome.description: Postoperative sedation was assessed using the Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale (RASS). It ranges from -5 to +4, where -5 indicates no response to voice or physical stimulation and +4 indicates overtly combative or violent and immediate danger to staff. Lower the value, better the sedation.
outcome.time_frame: Measured at 8, 16, and 24 hours after surgery
outcome.population: RASS scores were not collected at certain time points if patients were not available (e.g., patient was away at a test) or if staff were not available.

group.title: IV Acetaminophen
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. IV Acetaminophen: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. Placebo: Patients will receive up to four doses placebo every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids.

measure.title: Postoperative Sedation
measure.description: Postoperative sedation was assessed using the Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale (RASS). It ranges from -5 to +4, where -5 indicates no response to voice or physical stimulation and +4 indicates overtly combative or violent and immediate danger to staff. Lower the value, better the sedation.
measure.population: RASS scores were not collected at certain time points if patients were not available (e.g., patient was away at a test) or if staff were not available.

analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in medians of IV acetaminophen versus placebo patients based on Wilcoxon rank sum test and Hodges-Lehmann estimation of location shift.
Difference in medians of IV acetaminophen versus placebo patients based on Wilcoxon rank sum test and Hodges-Lehmann estimation of location shift.
Difference in medians of IV acetaminophen versus placebo patients based on Wilcoxon rank sum test and Hodges-Lehmann estimation of location shift.

outcome.title: Duration of Mechanical Ventilation (Minutes)
outcome.description: Evaluate whether IV acetaminophen reduced duration of Mechanical Ventilation.
outcome.time_frame: End of surgery until the initial end of ventilation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 1 week.

group.description: Patients will receive up to four doses of IV Acetaminophen (1000mg)every six hours after surgery along with standard PCA (patient controlled) opioids. measure.title: Duration of Mechanical Ventilation (Minutes)
measure.description: Evaluate whether IV acetaminophen reduced duration of Mechanical Ventilation.

analysis.estimate_desc: Outcome log-transformed to meet model assumptions. The treatment effect on duration of mechanical ventilation was assessed by use of the ratio of geometric means from a multivariable logistic regression models adjusting for age and diabetes.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
